dev:remarks.maml:para:
NET-Experts PowerShell Support for JetBrains YouTrack Rest API Version 1.2.3.0

maml:description.maml:para: Connect to the given YouTrack service
This function connects to a given YouTrack service using the REST API to authenticate and returns the web request session object.
Specify the user to use for authenticating with JetBrains YouTrack REST API.
Specify the password to use for authenticating with JetBrains YouTrack REST API.
Specify the Uri of the JetBrains YouTrack API.
Specify the user to use for authenticating with JetBrains YouTrack REST API.
Specify the password to use for authenticating with JetBrains YouTrack REST API.
Specify the Uri of the JetBrains YouTrack API.

maml:alert.maml:para:
The JetBrains Example regarding the Auth is a bit wired! They append the User and password to the request URL and everybody who can see the traffic can see this info! So I changed it to "x-www-form-urlencoded" and put the User and password in the body. Still not cool (secure), but if you use SSL it should be OK because then it is still in the body and this is never transfered in clear text. They do the same in some of the examples theypublished and I think this is much better!
JetBrains wants us to use OAuth 2.0 with the Hub instance, but this was to complicated for me right now. I will do that later cause I do not have the standalone Hub yet :-)

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will establish a connection to the JetBrains YouTrack API 'https://issues.contoso.com:8443' and connects with the login credentials of the given account. It will save the authorization inf o in the Variable 'YouTrackWebSession'. You can re-Use this by '$YouTrackWebSession' as long as the session is active. If you close the session, or the Timeout hits, just run this function again!

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new item in a given JetBrains YouTrack project.
Creates a new item in a given JetBrains YouTrack project. Open an Issue, Bug Report or whatever you like to do with it.
Specify the name of the project to create the item.
Specify the summary information for the item.
Specify the description information for the item.
Specify the web request session value to use for authentication against the JetBrains YouTrack API.
Specify the Uri of the JetBrains YouTrack API.
Specify the name of the project to create the item.
Specify the summary information for the item.
Specify the description information for the item.
Specify the web request session value to use for authentication against the JetBrains YouTrack API.
Specify the Uri of the JetBrains YouTrack API.

maml:alert.maml:para: The Call of this function is based on an idea of Dean Grant <https://deangrant.wordpress.com/tag/powershell/> I needed to adopt his Invoke-WebRequest based call cause my favorite Invoke-RestMethod returned 0 bytes all the time.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-YouTrackItem -YouTrackProject "WEBSUPPORT" -YouTrackSummary "CSS Problem" -YouTrackDescription "Some Styles are wrong when I access the site via my Edge browser. Works fine in IE."

dev:remarks.maml:para:
WEBSUPPORT-4711
Generates an Issue in the YouTrack Project 'WEBSUPPORT'. The Issue has the Title 'CSS Problem' and the Description 'Some Styles are wrong when I access the site via my Edge browser. Works fine in IE.'. The Issue generated is 'WEBSUPPORT-4711'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $MyNewTicket = (New-YouTrackItem -YouTrackProject "WEBSUPPORT" -YouTrackSummary "CSS Problem" -YouTrackDescription "Some Styles are wrong when I access the site via my Edge browser. Works fine in IE.")

dev:remarks.maml:para:
WEBSUPPORT-4711
Generates an Issue in the YouTrack Project 'WEBSUPPORT'. The Issue has the Title 'CSS Problem' and the Description 'Some Styles are wrong when I access the site via my Edge browser. Works fine in IE.'. The Issue number is saved in the variable '$MyNewTicket' (e.g. something like WEBSUPPORT-4711), so you can reuse it to modify the new issue right after it is created!

maml:description.maml:para: Check if the Item exists in YouTrack
Helper function to do a basic check if a given issue exists in YouTrack or not. It return a simple Boolean as indicator.
YouTrack item that should be checked
Specify the Uri of the JetBrains YouTrack API.
Specify the web request session value to use for authentication against the JetBrains YouTrack API.
YouTrack item that should be checked
Specify the Uri of the JetBrains YouTrack API.
Specify the web request session value to use for authentication against the JetBrains YouTrack API.

maml:alert.maml:para: Simple Call that I use within my other calls. So I make sure that the issue exists before I go any further and try to do something with it.

dev:remarks.maml:para:
True
Check if the Item "SUPPORT-4711" exists. The Return (True) indicates that this item exists.

False
Check if the Item "SUPPORT-4711" exists. The Return (False) indicates that this item doesn't exists. We leave the URI and YouTrackSession variables empty, that indicates that the defaults are used and the URI is set via the Initialize-YouTrackConnection command

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get a list of all existing items in YouTrack Project 'SUPPORT' and dumps it to the console.

Get a list of all existing items in YouTrack Project 'SUPPORT' and put it to the '$YTReport' object, so you can re use it within other functions, scripts, whatever.
EXAMPLE PS C:\> $YTReport = @(Get-YouTrackItemListInProject -YouTrackProject 'SUPPORT' -YouTrackURI 'https://support.contoso.com:8443' -wikify)
Get a list of all existing items in YouTrack Project 'SUPPORT' and puty it to the '$YTReport' object, so you can re use it within other functions, scripts, whatever. Issue description in the response should be formatted while the 'wikify' switch is used.

maml:alert.maml:para: Please note that this POST method allows updating issue summary and/or description, only. To update issue fields, please use method to Apply Command to an Issue.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Will update the Item 'SUPPORT-4711' and change the summary/title to 'New Summary'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Update-YouTrackItem -YouTrackItem 'SUPPORT-4711' -YouTrackSummary 'Not working on PowerShell 5' -YouTrackDescription 'Tried the function on Windows 10 (PowerShell 5) and it soe nothing. There is no error message, just did nothing.'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Will update the Item 'SUPPORT-4711' and change the summary/title to 'Not working on PowerShell 5' and it also updates the description field of the item.
